content: On July 5, 2001, the Atlanta Braves celebrated a thrilling 10-9 victory over the Cincinnati Reds in a game that showcased the power of their offense. In a dramatic finish, Chipper Jones hit a two-run home run in the bottom of the eighth inning, propelling the Braves to a comeback win. This game was part of a remarkable season where the Braves would go on to claim their 10th consecutive division title, highlighting their dominance in the National League during the late '90s and early 2000s.
